LOBL.content: in one’s most mournful glory: “turn oneself into a mouthful,” swallow oneself so as to be close to oneself, absolute knowledge [this is from GLAS]
LOBL.linkedContent: in one’s most mournful glory: “turn oneself into a mouthful,” swallow oneself so as to be close to oneself, absolute knowledge [this is from GLAS]

SPOM.content: good conscience loses chance of abyssal desert, “desert in desert,” chaotic desert as open mouth, coming of other (messianic: ineffaceable mark of Marx’s legacy) [see p. 209]
SPOM.linkedContent: good conscience loses chance of abyssal desert, “desert in desert,” chaotic desert as open mouth, coming of other (messianic: ineffaceable mark of Marx’s legacy) [see p. 209]

POOF.content: vocative version [re: “O my friends…”], the “wrong” one, a self-contradiction that torments very act of enunciation, gaping-mouthed clamour (clameur à bouche bée) > the dative version is a neutral report
POOF.linkedContent: vocative version [re: “O my friends…”], the “wrong” one, a self-contradiction that torments very act of enunciation, gaping-mouthed clamour (clameur à bouche bée) > the dative version is a neutral report

T.content: tympanum, Dionysianism, Ariadne’s Thread, labyrinth: by means of the breach (fellure) of philosophical identity, which amounts to addressing the truth to itself in an envelope, to hearing it speak inside without opening its mouth or showing its teeth, the bloodiness of a disseminated writing separates the lips, violates the embouchure of philosophy, contact w/ another code, a unique event, unreadable as such, inaudible, btwn earth & sea, w/out signature
T.linkedContent: tympanum, Dionysianism, Ariadne’s Thread, labyrinth: by means of the breach (fellure) of philosophical identity, which amounts to addressing the truth to itself in an envelope, to hearing it speak inside without opening its mouth or showing its teeth, the bloodiness of a disseminated writing separates the lips, violates the embouchure of philosophy, contact w/ another code, a unique event, unreadable as such, inaudible, btwn earth & sea, w/out signature

F.content: mouth’s empty cavity: 1) place for shouts, sobs, “deferred filling,” 2) place to call mother 3) then, via introj. or auto-affection, “phonic self-filling”
F.linkedContent: mouth’s empty cavity: 1) place for shouts, sobs, “deferred filling,” 2) place to call mother 3) then, via introj. or auto-affection, “phonic self-filling”

F.content: 1st paradigm of introjection: “fill the mouth’s void w/ words” [Abraham] > language substituted as a figure of presence w/in a community of empty mouths
F.linkedContent: 1st paradigm of introjection: “fill the mouth’s void w/ words” [Abraham] > language substituted as a figure of presence w/in a community of empty mouths

F.content: introj. as idealization, incorp. refuses metaphor of substitutive supplement, refuses introj.; incorp. fantasy takes introj.’s oral metaphor literally: vomits into inside, into pocket of cyst
F.linkedContent: introj. as idealization, incorp. refuses metaphor of substitutive supplement, refuses introj.; incorp. fantasy takes introj.’s oral metaphor literally: vomits into inside, into pocket of cyst

OTO.content: the umbilicus has you by the ear, the ear is “taking notes,” the master a mouth (ear, mouth: both invaginated, involuted orifices) > the umbilical cord of State (dead father, cold monster) education, like a leash, commands us to write—that’s uncanny
OTO.linkedContent: the umbilicus has you by the ear, the ear is “taking notes,” the master a mouth (ear, mouth: both invaginated, involuted orifices) > the umbilical cord of State (dead father, cold monster) education, like a leash, commands us to write—that’s uncanny

PS.content: for Artaud, organ is place of loss: its center always an orifice, always functions as embouchure
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, organ is place of loss: its center always an orifice, always functions as embouchure

DST.content: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech
DST.linkedContent: caesura marks withdrawal of divine, plays at & undoes mourning > doubles work of mourning (the speculative, the dialectic, the opposition, the identification, the nostalgic interiorization, even the double bind of imitation), caesura takes one’s breath away (coupe le souffle), open mouth, pour donner, pour recevoir: quand elle a de la chance, gives one speech

D.content: “square mouth” —square horizontality of page, cadre, frame—squared opening

TN.content: Nancy’s distinction btwn orality and buccality, the latter a more “primitive” figure of the mouth, before speech?
TN.linkedContent: Nancy’s distinction btwn orality and buccality, the latter a more “primitive” figure of the mouth, before speech?

TN.content: Nancy: “the incommensurable extension of thinking is the opening of the mouth” > mouth as union of soul/body; Nancy accords decisive authority to “quasi” in Descartes’ “quasi permixtio”
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: “the incommensurable extension of thinking is the opening of the mouth” > mouth as union of soul/body; Nancy accords decisive authority to “quasi” in Descartes’ “quasi permixtio”

TN.content: mouth before speaking, before orality, wouldn’t this be the mother’s lips, giving ex-
TN.linkedContent: mouth before speaking, before orality, wouldn’t this be the mother’s lips, giving ex-

TN.content: Nancy: mouth is neither substance nor figure
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: mouth is neither substance nor figure

TN.content: for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth

TN.content: Nancy: faceless mouth, structure of a mask
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: faceless mouth, structure of a mask

TN.content: for Nancy, cogito neither point nor space, Nancy’s altercation w/ Descartes occurs btwn improbable pineal gland & a mouth from before speech > an opening anoral & already touching
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, cogito neither point nor space, Nancy’s altercation w/ Descartes occurs btwn improbable pineal gland & a mouth from before speech > an opening anoral & already touching

TN.content: laughter, especially a peal or burst, is like a syncope, even if it shakes up whole body—it’s a thing of the mouth
TN.linkedContent: laughter, especially a peal or burst, is like a syncope, even if it shakes up whole body—it’s a thing of the mouth

ATM.content: for Levinas, logos is not secondary/instrumental, it remains indispensable as fold (pli) that bends (se plie) to the gift, as the tongue (langue) of my mouth when I tear bread from it to give it to the other > it is also my body
ATM.linkedContent: for Levinas, logos is not secondary/instrumental, it remains indispensable as fold (pli) that bends (se plie) to the gift, as the tongue (langue) of my mouth when I tear bread from it to give it to the other > it is also my body

ATM.content: for Levinas, to make passage to other, there can’t be an absolute erasure, withdrawal must appear, “He,” only there in seriasure, a series of hiatuses (mouth agape), enlaced erasures
ATM.linkedContent: for Levinas, to make passage to other, there can’t be an absolute erasure, withdrawal must appear, “He,” only there in seriasure, a series of hiatuses (mouth agape), enlaced erasures

E.content: analogy of God and poet proceeds from and returns to logos, source as mouth and outlet (embouchure)
E.linkedContent: analogy of God and poet proceeds from and returns to logos, source as mouth and outlet (embouchure)

E.content: Kant’s exemplorality, exemplary orality, the mouth—os as absolute of every analogon: mouth is the measure of taste, of good art, it’s also the measure of bad taste (consumptive taste): one expressive (emissive) the other vomitive (emitic) > 2 means of entering/leaving the mouth
E.linkedContent: Kant’s exemplorality, exemplary orality, the mouth—os as absolute of every analogon: mouth is the measure of taste, of good art, it’s also the measure of bad taste (consumptive taste): one expressive (emissive) the other vomitive (emitic) > 2 means of entering/leaving the mouth

E.content: if pure taste demands non-consumption, wouldn’t disgust (rejection) be origin of pure taste?
E.linkedContent: if pure taste demands non-consumption, wouldn’t disgust (rejection) be origin of pure taste?

E.content: for Kant, the mouth (from which comes the highest form of expression) is self-affecting
E.linkedContent: for Kant, the mouth (from which comes the highest form of expression) is self-affecting

E.content: for Kant, hearing is closest to freedom and spontaneity, one must use term hearing-oneself-speak (le s’entendre-parler) because the structure is auto-affective; the mute thus do not have reason, the mouth (indissociable from ear) is not simply an analogy of expression: it is the ground of analogy, regulates analogy, it is logos itself [necessary]
E.linkedContent: for Kant, hearing is closest to freedom and spontaneity, one must use term hearing-oneself-speak (le s’entendre-parler) because the structure is auto-affective; the mute thus do not have reason, the mouth (indissociable from ear) is not simply an analogy of expression: it is the ground of analogy, regulates analogy, it is logos itself [necessary]

E.content: [re: internal, exemplorality of mouth’s auto-affection] what is not regulated by exemplorality, what is its bord ou le débord absolu? > the border which traces limit/frame of its parergon? the border that doesn’t enter into this framed, hierarchized, regulated theory? what is excluded & what gives form to exemplorality proceeding from this exclusion? [can’t be named]
E.linkedContent: [re: internal, exemplorality of mouth’s auto-affection] what is not regulated by exemplorality, what is its bord ou le débord absolu? > the border which traces limit/frame of its parergon? the border that doesn’t enter into this framed, hierarchized, regulated theory? what is excluded & what gives form to exemplorality proceeding from this exclusion? [can’t be named]

E.content: what is absolutely foreclosed from Kant’s system is not vomit but possibility of vicariousness of vomit, of its replacement by anything else: something that would undo the hierarchizing authority of logocentric analogy—its power of identification > i.e. the “in the place of,” replacement that has no proper place, no return: [the] in place of prosthesis —— w/in logocentric system (w/in the name), one simply can’t name what’s outside it, to say it would be to eat it—or, what is no longer absolutely different—to vomit it
E.linkedContent: what is absolutely foreclosed from Kant’s system is not vomit but possibility of vicariousness of vomit, of its replacement by anything else: something that would undo the hierarchizing authority of logocentric analogy—its power of identification > i.e. the “in the place of,” replacement that has no proper place, no return: [the] in place of prosthesis —— w/in logocentric system (w/in the name), one simply can’t name what’s outside it, to say it would be to eat it—or, what is no longer absolutely different—to vomit it

EW.content: link the question of “who” to the question of “sacrifice,” phallogocentrism as a schema of carnivorous virility
EW.linkedContent: link the question of “who” to the question of “sacrifice,” phallogocentrism as a schema of carnivorous virility

EW.content: carno-phallogocentrism: a heterotautology as a priori synthesis, i.e. “speculative idealism,” “becoming-subject of substance,” “absolute knowledge,” “speculative Good Friday” > idealizing interiorization of phallus and its necessity of its passage through the mouth
EW.linkedContent: carno-phallogocentrism: a heterotautology as a priori synthesis, i.e. “speculative idealism,” “becoming-subject of substance,” “absolute knowledge,” “speculative Good Friday” > idealizing interiorization of phallus and its necessity of its passage through the mouth

AD.content: engaged by promise while hearing silence it bears at heart of call—figure of hiatus, mouth open to speak/eat
AD.linkedContent: engaged by promise while hearing silence it bears at heart of call—figure of hiatus, mouth open to speak/eat

BSi.content: sovereignty, devoro, voraz, vorator, devour w/ teeth, rush to bite > kill or mourn the other?
BSi.linkedContent: sovereignty, devoro, voraz, vorator, devour w/ teeth, rush to bite > kill or mourn the other?

BSi.content: devouring and vociferation (voice exteriorizes what is eaten, what is interiorized) > listening, obeying the sovereign voice through donkey’s ears [sovereign devours, like beast, to speak as sovereign to stupid beast]
BSi.linkedContent: devouring and vociferation (voice exteriorizes what is eaten, what is interiorized) > listening, obeying the sovereign voice through donkey’s ears [sovereign devours, like beast, to speak as sovereign to stupid beast]

BSi.content: double carry (portée) of mouth (human) & maw (animal): voci-ferates (carry the voice) & devours (voracious carry)
BSi.linkedContent: double carry (portée) of mouth (human) & maw (animal): voci-ferates (carry the voice) & devours (voracious carry)

SPEC.content: [Freud’s mouth cancer and surgery] mouth eating itself, speaking through what it eats
SPEC.linkedContent: [Freud’s mouth cancer and surgery] mouth eating itself, speaking through what it eats

SPEC.content: transference, ersatz, prosthesis, at the mouth, Freud’s surgeries, cigar: les pas de plus et les plus de pas [?]
SPEC.linkedContent: transference, ersatz, prosthesis, at the mouth, Freud’s surgeries, cigar: les pas de plus et les plus de pas [?]

FV.content: depth is height, flows out (débouche) toward the high, precisely the mouth (bouche) in which is “incarnated” the Nous, Logos, phallic signifier > reason is reason itself, aura raison, logic of kettle (a check [traite] drawn from reason): there is only one libido, it is masculine in nature
FV.linkedContent: depth is height, flows out (débouche) toward the high, precisely the mouth (bouche) in which is “incarnated” the Nous, Logos, phallic signifier > reason is reason itself, aura raison, logic of kettle (a check [traite] drawn from reason): there is only one libido, it is masculine in nature
